conclusion: Analyze the motion of the particle in both the electric and magnetic fields.
The particle is launched horizontally with velocity v_0.
The electric field E is directed vertically downward.
The force on the particle due to the electric field is F = qE.
The acceleration a in the vertical direction is a = qE/m.
The horizontal distance to point P is l.
The time t to reach point P is t = l/v_0.
The vertical displacement y when the particle reaches point P is y = qEl^2/(2mv_0^2).
The particle enters the magnetic field with a velocity at an angle of 60 degrees to the horizontal.
The vertical component of the velocity v_y is v_y = v_0 sqrt(3).
The magnetic force provides the centripetal force for circular motion: qvB = mv^2/r.
The velocity v is the resultant of v_0 and v_y: v = 2v_0.
The radius r of the circular path is r = 2mv_0/(qB).
The particle exits between points Q and N, implying it travels a quarter circle.
The vertical displacement in the magnetic field is r.
The total vertical displacement from the launch point to the exit point is y_total = qEl^2/(2mv_0^2) + r.
The distance from the launch point to point P is the vertical displacement in the electric field: d = qEl^2/(2mv_0^2).
The distance from the particle's launch position to point P is qEl^2/(2mv_0^2).
